comments: a(n) is the smallest k such that n appears in the k X k multiplication table and A027424(k) is the number of n with a(n) <= k.
references: G. Tenenbaum, pp. 268ff of R. L. Graham et al., eds., Mathematics of Paul Erdős I.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..10000
prog: (PARI) A033677(n) = {local(d); d=divisors(n); d[length(d)\2+1]} \\ _Michael B. Porter_, Feb 26 2010(Haskell)a033677 n = head $   dropWhile ((< n) . (^ 2)) [d | d <- [1..n], mod n d == 0]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 20 2011
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
